functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: Of both current and former members of South Korean boy band Astro, how many members were born in March?

<document>
<title>Astro (South Korean band)</title>
<content>
South Korean boy band



| Astro
 |
| --- |
| ![](image)Astro in Sept 2017From left to right: Sanha, MJ, Moonbin, Eunwoo, Jinjin, and Rocky
 |
| Background information |
| Origin | Seoul, South Korea |
| Genres | * K-pop
* electropop

* Universal Japan

**Astro** (Korean: 아스트로; stylized in all caps) is a South Korean boy band formed by Fantagio.[1] The group is composed of four members: MJ, Jinjin, Cha Eun-woo, and Yoon San-ha.[2] Originally a six-piece group, Rocky departed from the group on February 28, 2023,[3] and Moonbin died on April 19, 2023.[4] They debuted on February 23, 2016, with the extended play *Spring Up* and were subsequently named as one of the best new K-pop acts of 2016 by *Billboard*.[5]




## Career[edit]


### Pre-debut[edit]


Astro was formed through the rookie talent development program "iTeen Boys", which was created by their agency Fantagio.[6] In August 2015, the final member line-up and group name were announced.[7] The same month, the group starred in a web drama titled *To Be Continued*, which aimed to introduce them to the public. The drama featured the members as themselves, as well as Kim Sae-ron, Seo Kang-joon, and the girl group Hello Venus.[8]


After their web drama finished airing, the group started the "Meet U" project. As part of the project, Astro traveled through South Korea, covering songs in front of crowds and holding fan meetings. Along with the performances, a KakaoTalk Plus Friends account was set up. Fantagio stated that once the group had gathered 10,000 friends on the app, they would announce their official debut date.[9] The goal was met by December 2015.[10] Their debut showcase, held on January 28, 2016, was sold out in under a minute and far exceeded the original limit of 1,000 attendants.[11][12] There, they also announced their official fan club name, Aroha.


They also appeared in their own reality TV show titled *Astro OK! Ready*, which began airing on January 21, 2016, on MBC every1[13] and concluded on February 18, 2016.[14]



### 2016: Debut with *Spring Up* and rising popularity[edit]


On February 23, 2016, Astro released their debut extended play *Spring Up* alongside its lead single "Hide & Seek".[15] For two days, starting on February 22, 2016, showcases and press conferences were held at Lotte Card Art Center[16] and Wapop Concert Hall[17] to commemorate the group's first release. Within a week of its release, *Spring Up* reached number six on the *Billboard* World Albums Chart in the United States,[18] as well as number four on the Gaon Album Chart.
[19] On February 25, the group released the music video for "Cat's Eye" (장화 신은 고양이), containing clips from their web drama *To Be Continued*. On April 13, Astro was the only Korean act invited to the LeTV Entertainment Awards in China. Due to their popularity in China, Cha Eun-woo was also offered a role in a Chinese drama shortly after their debut.[20]


Their second extended play *Summer Vibes* was released on July 1.[21] The album peaked at number six on the *Billboard* World Albums Chart[22] and at number two on the Gaon Album Chart.[23] Furthermore, the music video for "Breathless" (숨가빠), featuring labelmate Choi Yoo-jung of Weki Meki, surpassed half a million views in just three days.[24] The same month, on July 31, Astro performed in front of more than 20,000 people at Staples Center in Los Angeles for KCON 2016.[25][26]


Just five months after their debut, Astro held their first solo mini concert titled *Astro 2016 Mini Live – Thankx Aroha* from August 27 to 28 at the KEPCO Art Center in Seoul.[27][28] Additional showcases were held in Japan,[29] Indonesia,[30] and Thailand[31] throughout the months of October and November.


The group released their third extended play *Autumn Story* on November 10.[32] The music video to its lead single "Confession" (고백) featured Sei of Weki Meki. Simultaneously, their reality TV show *Astro Project A.S.I.A*, which explored the events of their first oversea showcases, began airing.[33] In December, *Billboard* named Astro one of the best new K-pop groups of 2016.[5]



### 2017–2018: First tour, group hiatus, and *Rise Up*[edit]


![](image)Astro at their showcase for *Dream Part.01*
On February 22, 2017, one day before their one-year anniversary, Astro's four seasons project came to a close with their special album *Winter Dream*. The album and its lead single "Again" (붙잡았어야 해) were neither promoted on any music shows nor did they receive a music video.[34] The group did, however, resume their overseas showcases with performances in Thailand, Taiwan, Singapore, and Hong Kong.[35] The group released their fourth extended play *Dream Part.01*, featuring the lead single "Baby", on May 29.[36] The album placed sixth on the *Billboard* World Albums Chart.[37] The same month, Astro signed a contract with Avex Taiwan to handle their music distribution in Taiwan, China, Hong Kong, and Southeast Asia.[38] On July 15, 2017, the group started their first tour, titled *The 1st Astroad to Seoul*, in Seoul at Olympic Hall,[39][40] later expanding it with stops in Osaka, and Tokyo.[41] On November 1, Astro released their fifth extended play *Dream Part.02*, featuring the lead single "Crazy Sexy Cool" (니가 불어와).[42] A limited "Wish" edition of the EP was released on January 10, 2018. All 10,000 copies were sold out in pre-orders alone. The edition contains a poem written by member Cha Eun-woo titled "Purple Evening", a hidden "Thanks to", as well as polaroid pictures taken by the members themselves.[43]


The group held a second showcase in Taiwan on January 20, 2018, at the Taipei International Convention Center (TICC).[44] Throughout the months of February and March, Astro held twelve fan meetings across nine cities around the world, visiting the United States, Canada, South Korea, Japan, and Thailand.[45][46] On July 24, after a prolonged hiatus, Astro released their second special extended play *Rise Up* alongside its lead single "Always You" (너잖아). Due to internal issues at their label, Fantagio Music, the album was not promoted on music shows.[47][48] Still, the group proceeded to hold their second Japan tour *The 2nd Astroad to Japan* in August, with performances in Nagoya, Osaka, and Tokyo.[49][50] Another tour titled *The 2nd Astroad to Seoul [Star Light] (Part 1)* in South Korea followed, concluding on December 23 with a last performance in Seoul at KBS Hall.[51][52]



### 2019: First studio album *All Night*, Japanese debut with *Venus*, and Moonbin's hiatus[edit]


On January 16, 2019, following their 14-month hiatus without any full comeback, Astro released their first studio album *All Light*.[53][54] To further promote the album, the group continued their *The 2nd Astroad to Seoul [Star Light]* tour with shows in Taiwan,[55] the United States,[56] Hong Kong,[57] and Thailand.[58][59] On January 29, they received their first music show win for "All Night" (전화해) on the SBS MTV music program *The Show*.[60]


On April 3, Astro made their Japanese debut with the extended play *Venus*. The EP features three original Japanese tracks along with Japanese versions of their Korean singles "Baby", "Always You", and "All Night".[61] The release was well received by the general public, ranking third on the Oricon Weekly Album Chart[62] and peaking at number one on the Daily Album Chart.[63]


On November 12, Fantagio announced that Moonbin would be going on a hiatus to recover from health issues and focus on his treatment.[64] Subsequently, Moonbin did not participate in the promotions for the group's sixth extended play *Blue Flame*, which was released on November 20.[65] His parts were therefore temporarily re-distributed amongst the remaining members.[66] Despite this, he still took part in the recording of the EP and appeared in the music video for their lead single "Blue Flame".[67]



### 2020: *One & Only*, *Gateway*, and first sub-unit Moonbin & Sanha[edit]


On February 14, 2020, Moonbin appeared in a V Live broadcast with the other Astro members, officially ending his hiatus.[68] In celebration of their fourth debut anniversary, Astro released a special digital single album titled *One & Only* on February 23.[69] A physical edition of the single was released on March 13.[70]


In May 4, Astro released their seventh extended play *Gateway*.[71] On May 12, the EP's lead single "Knock" earned the group their second win on the MBC M music show *Show Champion*.[72] On June 28, Astro held their first online live streaming concert *2020 Astro Live on WWW.*, where they performed the song "No, I Don't" for the first time.[73] On the same day, the single was distributed digitally through various streaming services.[74]


On August 14, Fantagio confirmed that members Moonbin and Yoon San-ha would form Astro's first sub-unit called Moonbin & Sanha and that the recording for the unit's first extended play had already been completed.[75] Their debut EP *In-Out*, featuring the lead single "Bad Idea", was released on September 14.[76][77] Eight days later, on September 22, the sub-unit received their first music show award from *The Show*, making them the fastest K-pop sub-unit to receive their first win on a music show.[78]


On December 31, Astro released the digital single "We Still (Be With U)" as a special year-end gift to their fans. The song is a re-arranged, winter-themed version of the track "We Still" from their seventh extended play *Gateway*.[79]



### 2021: Second studio album *All Yours* and solo activities[edit]


On April 5, 2021, Astro released their second studio album *All Yours*.[80][81] The group received a total of three music show wins for its title track "One": the first one on *The Show* on April 13; the second on *Show Champion* on April 14; and finally on *M Countdown* on April 15, making it their first win on the program.[82] On June 10, *All Yours* became the first Astro album to be certified platinum by Gaon.[83][84]


On August 2, the group released their eighth extended play *Switch On*.[85][86] The music video for its lead single "After Midnight" garnered 10 million views in 34 hours, breaking the record previously set by "One".[87] On August 10, they earned their first music show win for "After Midnight" on *The Show*.[88] Just one day after, the group received their second win on *Show Champion*,[89] followed by their third win on *Music Bank* on August 13[90] and their fourth win on *Show! Music Core* on August 14.[91] This also marked their first win on the latter two music shows and their first win on national TV since their debut.[92] On October 7, *Switch On* was certified platinum by Gaon, making it their second album to reach platinum.[93]


On September 2, Astro released the promotional single "Alive" for the mobile application Universe, the music video to which was distributed exclusively through the app.[94] The song appeared at number 103 on the Gaon Download Chart.[95]


On October 14, Fantagio confirmed that MJ would be the first member to promote as a solo artist.[96] He made his solo debut with the semi-trot single album *Happy Virus* on November 3.[97] The song was released digitally and was produced by trot musician Young Tak.[98] The single also features child singer Kim Tae-yeon, who was also a contestant on *Miss Trot 2*.[99] On November 29, MJ became the first K-pop idol to ever place first on the SBS music program *The Trot Show*.[100]



### 2022–2023: Second sub-unit, MJ's enlistment, Rocky's departure, and Moonbin's death[edit]


![](image)From left to right: Moonbin, Jinjin, Rocky, and Sanha at the HallyuPopFest 2022 in London
On December 28, 2021, Fantagio announced that members Jinjin and Rocky would form Astro's second sub-unit, Jinjin & Rocky.[101][102] The duo released their debut extended play *Restore* and its lead single "Just Breath" (숨 좀 쉬자) on January 17, 2022.[103] On January 28, Fantagio announced that MJ would temporarily halt activities due to health issues.[104]


Originally scheduled for March 13,[105] Astro held their annual fan meeting Astro Aroha Festival to commemorate their sixth anniversary on April 9, this time titled 2022 Astro Aroha Festival [Gate 6]. The event was held both online and in person, making it their first fan meeting with a live audience since 2019, prior to the COVID-19 pandemic.[106] During the fan meeting, MJ announced that he would enlist in the military as part of his mandatory military service on May 9, making him the first Astro member to serve. He is serving in the military band.[107] On May 16, Astro released their third studio album *Drive to the Starry Road*.[108] The album features solo songs performed by all six members.[109] While he would not be able to partake in promotional activities due to his military enlistment, MJ took part in the music video shooting.[110] The album topped the Gaon Weekly Retail Album Chart in the week from May 15 to May 21, 2022, with 142,380 copies sold.[111][112] Its lead single "Candy Sugar Pop" won a total of four music show awards: the first one on *The Show* on May 24, the second on *Show Champion* on May 25, the third on *M Countdown* on May 26,[113] and the fourth on *Music Bank* on May 27.[114][115] From May 28 to May 29, Astro started their third solo concert tour *The 3rd Astroad to Seoul [Stargazer]* at the Jamsil Indoor Stadium in Seoul.[116][117][118] They continued their tour with *The 3rd Astroad to Japan* from June 3 to 4, selling out all 40,000 seats at Makuhari Messe International Exhibition Hall in Chiba near Tokyo.[119][120] On July 21, Astro released the promotional single "U&Iverse" for the Universe app through Universe Music.[121] "U&Iverse" appeared at number 95 on the Circle Download Chart.[122] On November 30, Astro released the Japanese single "Ichiban sukina hito ni sayonara wo iou" (1番好きな人にサヨナラを言おう; lit. 'Saying goodbye to the person I love most'). The music video features member Cha Eun-woo and Japanese actress and model Airi Matsui and was shot entirely in Japan. In addition, a solo version performed by Cha Eun-woo was recorded for the CD release.[123] On December 30, Fantagio released an official statement reporting that Jinjin, Cha Eun-woo, Moonbin, and Sanha had decided to renew their contracts, while Rocky's renewal was still in discussions and MJ's would be discussed after his discharge from the military.[124]


On February 28, 2023, it was announced that Rocky had ultimately decided to leave the agency and the group.[3][125] On April 20, Yonhap News reported that Moonbin had died the prior evening,[4] which was later confirmed by Astro's agency Fantagio.[126][127] The circumstances of his death are being investigated by the police.[4]

**Kim Myung-jun** (Korean: 김명준; March 5, 1994), known professionally as **MJ** (엠제이), is a South Korean singer and actor managed under the label of Fantagio. He debuted in 2016 as the main vocalist of the South Korean six-member boy group Astro. In August 2020, he debuted as one of the five members of an idol trot group named Super Five through MBC TV's reality trot show *Favorite Entertainment*.




## Life and career[edit]


### 2012–2015: Pre-debut[edit]


MJ was a contestant in the 2012 JYP Entertainment X HUM Audition and won a one-year scholarship from Seoul Arts College.[1]


MJ took part in Fantagio's iTeen, a rookie talent development program managed under the label of Fantagio. He and other members of Astro were known as iTeen Boys.


MJ along with the other members of Astro starred in a web drama series named "To be Continued" which featured the members as themselves.[2]



### 2016–2019: Debut with Astro and solo activities[edit]


See also: Astro (South Korean band)

MJ officially debuted as a member of Astro on February 23, 2016.


During Astro's 2nd ASTROAD To Seoul "Starlight" concert which was held on December 22–23, 2018, MJ performed his solo trot stage "Cheok Cheok".[3] It was included in the DVD of the concert which was released in June 2019.[4]


In February 2019, MJ sang his first OST titled "You're My Everything" for the Korean drama, *My Only One*.[5]


Also in February 2019, MJ along with Jin Ju, Hyomin, Heo Kyung-hwan, Kang Tae-oh travelled to Nha Trang for the Korean travel show "Have To Go to Know".[6]


In March 2019, MJ and Jinjin took part in the travel/variety show project of Celuv TV - *Go Together, Travel Alone*.[7] The show was filmed in Saipan and includes Tony Ahn, Han Seung-yeon, Jin Jin and Kim So-hye. It was later on released in a DVD format.


In June 2019, he co-hosted Insane Quiz Show Season 2, also abbreviated as "이세퀴" and "IQS S2", with BtoB's Illhoon and Loona's Chuu.[8]


In July 2019, MJ and Yoon San-ha were confirmed to be the MCs of the tvN D's variety talk show Blanket Kick at Night.[9]


In August 2019, MJ appeared in *King of Masked Singer* as Driver Kim.[5] Also in February 2019, MJ along with Jin Ju, Hyomin, Heo Kyung-hwan, Kang Tae-oh travelled to Nha Trang for the Korean travel show "Have To Go to Know".[6]



### 2020–present: Musical debut, Super Five and solo debut[edit]


In April 2020, MJ sang another OST for the Korean drama, *Eccentric! Chef Moon* titled "Sweet Spring".[10] In that same month, it was confirmed that MJ, together with 2AM's Jo Kwon, NU’EST's Ren, and Shin Joo Hyup were cast for the Korean version of the musical *Everybody's Talking About Jamie*.[*citation needed*] This is originally a British musical based on a true story of a teenager named Jamie, who aspires to become a drag queen. The musical was scheduled from 4 July to 11 September at LG Arts Center in Gangnam.[*citation needed*] On the September 11, 2020, MJ successfully finished his last show for the musical as Jamie.[11]


In July 2020, MJ was cast in MBC's *Favorite Entertainment*. He was selected as one of the five members of the idol trot group formed by Jang Yoon Jung and in charge of visual of the group.[12] The project boy group debuted on MBC's Music Core on August 22, 2020 under the name Super Five (다섯장).[13][14] MJ promoted with Super Five using his real name Kim Myung Jun. The group consists of Pentagon's Lee Hoe-taek, A.cian's Chu Hyeok-jin, Park Hyeong-seok and Ok Jin-wook. The group debuted with the songs "Hello" and "All Eyes on You".[15]


In 2021, he became the only MC for the 2nd season of *Fact In Star*. On October 14, Fantagio confirmed that MJ will debut as a solo artist with a semi-trot song to be released in November, which features Kim Tae-yeon from Miss Trot. Young Tak was also participating in the production of said song.[16] On October 18, it was confirmed that MJ was cast to play the role 'Daniel' in the musical 'Jack the Ripper'. MJ will play the role together with Uhm ki joon, F.T. Island's Lee Hong-ki and SF9's Inseong. The musical is slated to open on December 3 at the KEPCO Art Center in Seoul.[17] On October 28, 2021, MJ was announced as part of G-Market's mystery romance thriller web drama called *Find Me If You Can*. He played the role of a long time friend with the main lead actress. It was premiered on November 9, 2021, via *INSSA OPPA G* YouTube Channel.[18][19]


On November 3, MJ debuted as a solo artist with two songs — "Get Set Yo" and "Valet Parking".[20] On November 29, he won in SBS's The Trot Show and is the first idol to ever win first place on The Trot Show.[21]



## Personal life[edit]


On February 3, 2022, the agency confirmed that MJ would temporarily suspend his activities due to illness.[22]



### Military service[edit]


MJ enlisted in the military band as part of his mandatory military service on May 9, 2022.[23] He was discharged from military service on November 8, 2023.[24]

<title>Cha Eun-woo</title>
<content>
South Korean singer and actor (born 1997)





In this Korean name, the family name is  *Lee*. In the stage name or pen-name, the surname is *Cha*.

**Lee Dong-min** (Korean: 이동민; born March 30, 1997), known professionally as **Cha Eun-woo** (차은우), is a South Korean singer and actor under the label Fantagio. He is a member of the South Korean boy band Astro.




## Early life[edit]


Cha Eun-woo was born on March 30, 1997 in the city of Gunpo, Gyeonggi Province.[2][3][4] He attended Suri Middle School and Suri High School before graduating from Hanlim Multi Art School in 2016.[5] He studied at Sungkyunkwan University, majoring in performing arts in the theater department.[6]



## Career[edit]


### 2013–2015: Career beginnings[edit]


Cha debuted as an actor in 2014 with a minor role in the film *My Brilliant Life*.[7] He was the fourth trainee to be officially introduced with the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut. In August 2015, Cha, along with the other members of Astro, participated in the web-drama *To Be Continued*.[8]



### 2016–present: Debut with Astro, solo activities and rising popularity[edit]


See also: Astro (South Korean band)

![](image)Cha for *Marie Claire Korea* in 2020
Astro debuted on February 23, 2016, with the EP *Spring Up*. In August, Cha participated in the Chuseok special variety show, *Replies That Make Us Flutter*.[9] In September, he participated in another Chuseok pilot program, *Boomshakalaka*.[10]


Cha was announced as a host of *Show! Music Core* alongside Kim Sae-ron, Lee Soo-min and Xiyeon from 2016 to 2018.[11] In 2016, he also starred in the web drama *My Romantic Some Recipe*.[12]


In 2017, Cha was cast in the KBS2 drama *Hit the Top*[13] and starred in the web drama *Sweet Revenge*.[14]


In 2018, Cha starred in the web drama *Top Management*.[15] He was later cast in the JTBC romantic comedy series *Gangnam Beauty*, his first leading role on television.[16][17] He saw a rise in popularity after the series aired[18][19] and was included in GQ Korea's "Men of the Year".[20]


In 2019, Cha starred in the historical drama *Rookie Historian Goo Hae-ryung* alongside Shin Se-kyung.[21] He played the role of an royal prince who became a romance novelist, and won the Excellence Award for an Actor and Best Couple Award with Shin at the MBC Drama Awards.[22] In December, he was announced as a cast member of the new variety show *Handsome Tigers* alongside Joy, Lee Sang-yoon, Yoo Seon-ho, and Seo Jang-hoon.[23]


In April 2020, Cha joined SBS television show *Master in the House* as a fixed cast member.[24] At the 2020 SBS Entertainment Awards, he won the Rookie Award for his role on the show.[25] In December 2020, he starred in the tvN coming-of-age romance drama *True Beauty* based on the webtoon of the same name, playing a high school student alongside Moon Ga-young.[26][27]


In June 2021, he left *Master in the House*.[28] In November 2021, Cha released "Don't Cry, My Love", a ballad song featuring a piano performance, for the official soundtrack of the comic *Under The Oak Tree*.[29]


In 2022, Cha recorded "Focus on Me" for the soundtrack of the Kakao webtoon *The Villainess Is a Marionette*, released on February 22.[30] He then played the role of a Navy officer in Hwang In-ho's urban terror action film *Decibel* which was released in November 2022.[31] Later that year he starred in TVING drama *Island* alongside Kim Nam-gil, Lee Da-hee and Sung Joon, playing the role of an exorcist priest.[32] On December 30, Fantagio released an official statement stating that Cha had decided to renew his contract with the agency.[33]


In 2023, Cha is set to star in the webtoon-based fantasy romance drama *A Good Day to Be a Dog*.[34] On June 1, Cha was confirmed for *Wonderful World* led by veteran actress Kim Nam-joo with premiere scheduled for the first half of 2024.[35] On October 18, Cha released the remake of "Jealousy", which was originally sung by Yoo Seung-beom, for the official soundtrack of the drama A Good Day To Be A Dog.[36] On October 27, Cha became the first Asian artist to receive the Global Icon Award on MTV Video Music Awards Japan 2023, a special award given to honor the achievements of global activities as an artist.[37]



## Other ventures[edit]


### Endorsements[edit]


In February 2021, Cha became Penshoppe's international ambassador.[38] In March, he was selected as the brand model for Noona Holdak Chicken.[39] In May, Cha was chosen as a new model for clothing brand O'Neill.[40][41] In July, Cha became a brand ambassador for Burberry.[42][43] Cha was then chosen as Konvy's first presenter,[44][45] as well as a model for Mackiss Company's Now We Are *soju*[46] and the health functional food Perilla in the Eyes.[47] In August, Cha was selected as a model for Samhwa Foods,[48] and the new muse of Dashu Perfume.[49]


In January 2022, Cha became the muse for the hair styling brand Dashu.[50] The next two months, he became as a new brand ambassador for Ms Glow,[51][52] and Mister Potato.[53][54] In April 2022, Cha modeled for contemporary men's clothing brand Liberclassy.[55] In June, Cha became a brand ambassador for Dior Beauty, announced after attending Jean-Michel Othoniel's exhibition.[56][57] In December, there was a post announcing Cha became a brand ambassador for Dior.[58][59]


In January 2023, Cha became a regional brand ambassador for Skechers, this partnership covers seven key Asia-Pacific markets for Skechers: Singapore, Hong Kong, Macau, Malaysia, Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam.[60] In February, Cha and actress Han So-hee were selected as CF models together for global clothing brand Giordano.[61] Cha launches the global campaign 2023 NEW Liens collection Liens Evidence, featuring a bridge that connects two people who express different emotions. that can be experienced in important moments of life with Chaumet's unique artistic sense.[62][63][64] In March, Cha became a brand ambassador for Est Cola.[65] Cha became a brand ambassador for Dunkin’ Philippines.[66] In May, Cha has been appointed as honorary ambassador for the '2023–2024 Visit Korea Year', participated in the launching ceremony of the 'K-Tourism Cooperation Group' along with First Lady Kim Keon-hee and Chairperson Lee Boo-jin.[67] In June, Cha has been selected as a brand model for Subway and plans to continue various activities starting with the "Eat Fresh, Feel Good" campaign video that will be sent to major Asian countries including Korea next month.[68] In August, Cha has been selected as a brand model for Chung Jungwon Home:ings.[69] Cha has been selected as the new brand ambassador for outdoor brand The North Face.[70] In October, Cha has been selected as the new brand ambassador for Ricola.[71] Cha is announced as the face of the insurance company Hanwha Life.[72]



### Philanthropy[edit]


In April 2019, Cha donated ₩10 million to help support the victims of the Sokcho Fire.[73] In February 2020, It was revealed that Cha had donated ₩30 million to help those affected by COVID-19 pandemic in South Korea.[74]


In June 2022, Cha participated as a special audio guide for the art exhibit of Sir Michael Craig-Martin & even donated some proceeds for cancer patients at the national cancer center.[75] In November 2022, it was announced that Cha will hold a photo exhibition at the end of the year and will donate all profits to help the underprivileged.[76]


In July 2023, Cha donated ₩10 million for the Ice Bucket Challenge campaign, receiving a challenge from actor Lee Jung-jae and he nominated Yoon San-ha, Moon Ga-young and Park Gyu-young to join the campaign.[77]



## Impact and influence[edit]


In November 2018, Cha was included as one of GQ Korea's Men of the Year.[20] In 2019, he ranked seventh—with 44,178,474 points—in the Most Accumulated Points On Male Idol Brand Reputation.[78][*unreliable source?*] In the K-pop Radar Year-End Chart of 2019, Cha was named as the male "Hot Instagrammer".[79]


In April 2021, Cha placed 17th on *Forbes* Korea Power Celebrity and sixth in the SNS category.[80] In April 2022, after Cha was selected to represent contemporary men's clothing brand Liberclassy,[55] traffic to the company's mall increased by 806% in the first week of April from the previous week, and the brand also saw an increase in social media engagement.[81] An official from Liberclassy said, "The Cha Eunwoo effect was seen as more than 70 million won in sales generated for pre-application alone".[82]

**Yoon San-ha** (Korean: 윤산하; born March 21, 2000), also known mononymously as **Sanha**, is a South Korean singer and actor under the label Fantagio. He is a member of the South Korean boy group Astro and was a member of its sub-unit Moonbin & Sanha.




## Early life[edit]


Yoon San-ha was born on March 21, 2000. He graduated from Hanlim Multi Art School in 2019.[2]


He is the youngest in his family. Sanha has 2 older brothers: Jun-ha and Je-ha.[3]



## Career[edit]


### 2013–15: Career beginnings[edit]


Yoon was accepted as a Fantagio iTeen trainee on December 16, 2012. He was the third trainee to be officially introduced with the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut.[*citation needed*]


In August 2015, Yoon along with the other members of his group participated in the web-drama *To Be Continued*.[4]



### 2016–present: Debut with Astro, Solo activities[edit]


Main article: Astro (South Korean band)

Yoon debuted as part of the six-member group Astro on February 23, 2016, with the mini album *Spring Up*.[*citation needed*]


In July 2018, Yoon was chosen as a host for the teenager-focused talk show *Yogobara*. He hosted alongside GFriend's Umji.[5]


In July 2019, Yoon and MJ were confirmed to be the MCs of the TVN D's variety talk show *Blanket Kick at Night.*[6]


On March 4, 2020, Yoon was announced to be a new host for *Show Champion* along with bandmate Moonbin and Verivery's Kangmin.[7]


On August 14, 2020, Fantagio confirmed that Yoon and Moonbin would form Astro's first sub-unit, called Moonbin & Sanha. On September 14, 2020, they released their first extended play called *In-Out*, with the title track "Bad Idea".[8] They received their first win from SBS MTV's *The Show* marking their first win as a sub-unit and third win as Astro.[9]


On September 16, 2021, Fantagio confirmed that Yoon will be starring in a web drama titled *Your Playlist* alongside DreamNote's Sumin. The web drama premiered on October 15, 2021.[10]


On November 19, 2021, It was revealed that Yoon has been cast in the South Korean production of hit Off-Broadway musical *Altar Boyz*. Yoon will play the role of Abraham and will star alongside Golden Child's Y and Joochan, NU'EST's Baekho and SF9's Taeyang.[11]


In 2022, Yoon joined the KBS drama *Crazy Love* which was his debut terrestrial drama.[12]


On December 30, 2022, Fantagio released an official statement and stated that Yoon had decided to renew his contract with the agency.[13]


On April 19, 2023, after Moonbin's death, thus resulting in the sub-unit's disbandment.[14]

**Moonbin** (Korean: 문빈; January 26, 1998 – April 19, 2023), born as **Moon Bin**, was a South Korean singer, actor and dancer under the label Fantagio. He was a member of the South Korean boy group Astro and its sub-unit Moonbin & Sanha.




## Early life[edit]


Moonbin was born on January 26, 1998, in Cheongju, Chungbuk Province. He attended and graduated from Hanlim Multi Art School, focusing in Practical Music.[2]


He was one of two siblings in his family, with a younger sister named Moon Sua, who is a member of the South Korean girl group Billlie.[3]



## Career[edit]


### 2006–2015: Pre-debut[edit]


Under the influence of his mother, Moonbin debuted as a child model and *ulzzang* in 2004. His first known appearance was in 2006, where he appeared in TVXQ's music video for their song "Balloons" portraying a mini U-Know Yunho.[4] In 2009, he had his first acting role in the Korean drama *Boys over Flowers* where he played the younger version of Kim Bum's character.[5]


Moonbin began his journey with Fantagio as a trainee in fifth grade, eventually transitioning to a full-fledged trainee during his middle school years. He actively took part in the company's boy group project iTeen, and he was introduced through the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut.[6] Before his official debut with Astro, Moonbin and his fellow group members starred in a web-drama titled "*To Be Continued"*.[7]



### 2016–2022: Debut with Astro, solo activities, and unit debut[edit]


Main article: Astro (South Korean band)

![](image)Moonbin during the 2019 S/S Hera Seoul Fashion Week on October 19, 2018
Moonbin debuted as part of the six-member boy group Astro on February 23, 2016. Their debut extended play, *Spring Up*, contained five songs, including the lead single "Hide & Seek".[8] In 2018, Moonbin joined the cast of *The Ultimate Watchlist of Latest Trends*, participating in the first two seasons.[9][10] The following year, he was cast in *Moments of Eighteen*, where he played the character of Jung Oh-je.[11]


On November 12, 2019, Fantagio reported that due to health reasons, Moonbin would be absent from Astro's upcoming promotions for their *Blue Flame* EP release.[12] He ended his hiatus in February 2020 after appearing in a V Live broadcast with the other Astro members.[13] He was announced as one of the new hosts of the South Korean music show *Show Champion*, alongside his bandmate Yoon San-ha and Verivery's Kangmin.[14] He was confirmed to play the lead role in the web-drama *The Mermaid Prince*, a role which he reprised for a second season,[15][16] and joined the eco-friendly cooking program *Food Avengers*.[17]


In September 2020, Moonbin was announced as one of the fashion models for the brand Nerdy Cafe.[18] He and band-mate Sanha (Yoon San-ha) debuted as Astro's first sub-unit Moonbin & Sanha with the release of their debut EP, *In-Out*, along with its lead single, "Bad Idea", on September 14.[19] The unit received their first music show win from *The Show* eight days later.[20]


In 2021, Neikidnis revealed that it had selected Moonbin as their first muse.[21] Later that year, Moonbin was added as a cast member for the second season of Coupang Play's *Saturday Night Live Korea*.[22] On December 30, 2022, Fantagio released an official statement confirming that Moonbin had decided to renew his contract with the agency.[23]



## Death[edit]


On the evening of April 19, 2023, Moonbin was found dead at his home in the Gangnam District of Seoul at the age of 25.[1][24] He was found by his manager after he failed to attend rehearsals.[25] Yonhap News shared a statement released by the Seoul Gangnam Police who are investigating the death: "it appears that he took his own life. We are discussing the possibility of an autopsy to determine the precise cause of death."[1][26][27] On April 20, Gangnam Police told CNN that "no signs of foul play have been found related to this case."[28]


According to an official statement released by Fantagio on April 21, Moonbin was to be buried on April 22, 2023. The funeral procession and the burial site was kept private per the request of his family.[29][30]


A day before his death, it had been announced that Moonbin was set to perform at the Dream Concert in Busan with fellow Astro member Sanha as part of their duo, Moonbin & Sanha.[25] The organizers expressed their condolences on their social media accounts.[31][32]
